Problem:
Consider a complex-valued function \\(z(t)\\) governed by the differential equation \\(\\dot{z} = iz\\), and an integral transformation \\(T(z) = \\int_0^t e^{s^2} z(s) ds\\). We investigate how the results of further transformations and initial conditions evolve through the system.

Given the state \\(z(T)\\) at a time T, can we conclusively identify which transformations (either \\(T(z)\\), \\(G(z)\\), or both) were applied, solely from the knowledge of \\(z(T)\\)?
Explanation: The combination of different integral transformations along with the original evolution under \\(\\dot{z} = iz\\) results in overlapping effects that cannot be unambiguously disaggregated at the endpoint \\(z(T)\\). This overlap makes it impossible to uniquely pinpoint which transformations affected the pathway of the function z.
